events.originalText: US Airways Flight 1549 struck a flock of Canada geese during its climb out from New York City and made an emergency landing in the Hudson River (featured).
events.subtitle: US Airways Flight 1549
events.headline: US Airways Flight 1549 makes emergency landing in Hudson River after striking Canada geese

events.originalText: The Victoria Cross for Australia was instituted by letters patent; the first Commonwealth realm with a separate Victoria Cross award in its honours system.
events.subtitle: Victoria Cross for Australia
events.headline: Victoria Cross for Australia instituted by letters patent

events.originalText: The American serial police-procedural television show Hill Street Blues aired its pilot episode, "Hill Street Station".
events.subtitle: Police procedural
events.headline: Hill Street Blues airs pilot episode 'Hill Street Station'

events.originalText: Portugal and the nationalist factions UNITA, the MPLA and the FNLA signed the Alvor Agreement, ending the Angolan War of Independence.
events.subtitle: UNITA
events.headline: Portugal and nationalist factions sign Alvor Agreement, ending Angolan War of Independence

events.originalText: American serial killer Dennis Rader, also known as the "BTK killer", murdered his first four victims.
events.subtitle: Serial killer
events.headline: American serial killer Dennis Rader murders first four victims

events.originalText: The Republic of Biafra surrendered following a failed attempt at secession from Nigeria, ending the Nigerian Civil War.
events.subtitle: Biafra
events.headline: Republic of Biafra surrenders, ending Nigerian Civil War

events.originalText: The Green Bay Packers defeated the Kansas City Chiefs in the American football championship game now known as Super Bowl I.
events.subtitle: Green Bay Packers
events.headline: Green Bay Packers defeat Kansas City Chiefs in Super Bowl I

events.originalText: The Derveni papyrus (fragment pictured), the oldest surviving manuscript in Europe, was discovered in Macedonia in northern Greece.
events.subtitle: Derveni papyrus
events.headline: Oldest surviving manuscript in Europe, Derveni papyrus, discovered in Macedonia

events.originalText: Ilse Koch, the wife of the commandant of the Buchenwald and Majdanek concentration camps, was sentenced to life imprisonment by a West German court.
events.subtitle: Ilse Koch
events.headline: Ilse Koch sentenced to life imprisonment for crimes at concentration camps

events.originalText: The mutilated corpse of the Black Dahlia, a 22-year-old woman whose murder is one of the most famous unsolved crimes in the United States, was found in Leimert Park, Los Angeles.
events.subtitle: Black Dahlia
events.headline: Mutilated corpse of Black Dahlia found in Leimert Park, Los Angeles

events.originalText: The highest-capacity office building in the world, the headquarters of the United States Department of Defense known as the Pentagon, was dedicated.
events.subtitle: United States Department of Defense
events.headline: Pentagon, highest-capacity office building, dedicated in the United States

events.originalText: Spanish Civil War: Nationalist and Republican forces both withdrew after suffering heavy losses at the Second Battle of the Corunna Road.
events.subtitle: Spanish Civil War
events.headline: Nationalist and Republican forces withdraw after Second Battle of the Corunna Road

events.originalText: At least 10,700 people died when an earthquake registering 8.0 Mw struck Nepal and the Indian state of Bihar.
events.subtitle: 1934 Nepal–India earthquake
events.headline: 10,700 people die in Nepal and Bihar earthquake

events.originalText: A teenage girl in Banneux, Belgium, reported the first of several Marian apparitions, now known as Our Lady of Banneux.
events.subtitle: Banneux
events.headline: Teenage girl reports Marian apparition in Banneux, Belgium

events.originalText: A large molasses tank in Boston, Massachusetts, burst and a wave of molasses rushed through the streets , killing 21 people and injuring 150 others.
events.subtitle: Molasses
events.headline: Molasses tank burst in Boston, killing 21 and injuring 150

events.originalText: Construction on the Buffalo Bill Dam on the Shoshone River in the U.S. state of Wyoming, then the tallest dam in the world, was completed.
events.subtitle: Buffalo Bill Dam
events.headline: Buffalo Bill Dam completed in Wyoming, tallest dam in the world

events.originalText: Wilson Bentley took the first known photograph of a snowflake by attaching a bellows camera to a microscope.
events.subtitle: Wilson Bentley
events.headline: Wilson Bentley takes first known photograph of a snowflake

events.originalText: In Regent's Park, London, the ice on the lake broke, plunging skaters into the water and causing 40 deaths from drowning or hypothermia.
events.subtitle: Regent's Park
events.headline: 40 deaths from drowning or hypothermia as ice breaks in Regent's Park, London

events.originalText: American Civil War: The Union Army captured Fort Fisher, the last seaport of the Confederacy.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union Army captures Fort Fisher in American Civil War

events.originalText: In British Hong Kong, hundreds of Europeans were non-lethally poisoned by arsenic in bread from a locally owned bakery, leading to geopolitical tension.
events.subtitle: British Hong Kong
events.headline: Hundreds poisoned by arsenic in bread in British Hong Kong, leading to tension

events.originalText: War of 1812: The American frigate USS President, commanded by Commodore Stephen Decatur, was captured by a squadron of four British frigates.
events.subtitle: War of 1812
events.headline: USS President captured by British frigates in War of 1812
